title: Dat 73% Winrate Quinn

embed.description: LoL Statistics, Builds, Runes, Masteries, Skill Orders, Counters and Matchups for Quinn when played Top. Statistics include Quinn's Win Rate, Play Rate and Ban Rate. Counters include who Quinn Top is Strong or Weak Against.

body: Experienced Quinn players at ADC, Mid and Top have over 70% winrates on average. Compare this to the ~56% average for players experienced on a normal champ. I guess three massive buffs on a slightly weak, but incredibly snowbally+high skillcap champ was a bit over the top

replies.body: She's too strong. We'll nerf her early game through some base AD and some Q nerfs, and then she should be in a better spot. I had some stuff submitted on Wednesday to the build that goes to PBE, but it looks like we didn't ship to PBE on Wednesday due to the holiday week. Expect to see some stuff show up there on the next PBE build.
I hope this is a troll post.

well it's not, i fought hard to get her justice, and when she get's something good for herself she's a problem, of all the champs Quinn has to be nerfed, atleast play her before you gut her so you can see where the 'problem' is in her success
Come on, now. You can't seriously think that a small reduction to her overall damage is a gutting.

i just noticed...support-tahm is also sitting at a 73%winrate for experienced players.

i mean...you have to admit it´s really strange that you´d nerf unpopular champs like swain (and the current nerf is really overkill, just take dmg of his e and leave his cc alone) and quinn while the more popular outlyers that see a lot of pro play like Ryze and Tahm seems to be tolerated in their utterly broken state - even if they leave a lot less counterplay for opponents that actually now the matchups well compared to swain and quinn.

I also noticed that Tahm is allowed to stay so strong and yet no one is talking about it. I'm not talking "waah i lost to Tahm" that offers no information or context, im talking "why is Tahm allowed to deal 700 magic damage, move you away from your turret, and suppress you with only sightstone and giants belt as a tanky mobile support?"  

Tahm's suppress, as a support, does more damage than Malzahar's does, presumably because it requires a few more steps to use. My issue with this is its not very hard to get the stacks off on enemies with the long range huge slow, huge AoE long ranged minion cannon, and the fact the stacks take forever to go away.  

Personally though, I'm just tired of watching Tahm Kench 1v2 my ADC and Jungler while i try to harass and CC the enemy ADC...

"Tanky mobile support"

"Mobile Support"

"Mobile"

He has a pretty low base movement speed, and NO dashes/blinks, but he's mobile? He has his ult, but that's it. If that's mobile, then Twisted Fate must be really mobile too!
Well when he eats his ally he gains a crap ton of MS right? Its annoying that he can use this to chase or escape, as if his fatty slow and ability to completely negate all CC on allies wasn't enough.

Actually, if you've played enough Tahm, you'll realize that running away by eating someone isn't always the best idea. He has 335 base movement speed, and the boost goes up to 25% extra movement speed. Normally, the champion that you eat will have a higher movement speed anyways, so you're slowing them down.

> [{quoted}](name=Raid Boss Morde,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=XO82jltL,comment-id=0006000400000001000000000002000100010000,timestamp=2015-11-28T22:03:28.956+0000)
>
> Actually, if you've played enough Tahm, you'll realize that running away by eating someone isn't always the best idea. He has 335 base movement speed, and the boost goes up to 25% extra movement speed. Normally, the champion that you eat will have a higher movement speed anyways, so you're slowing them down.

(335 + boots) * 1.25 is higher than the movespeed of the person you're eating 95% of the time
This is almost never the case for me though... the people that I normally eat usually have over 400 movement speed, and speed boosts/dashes/blinks.
Who can then use that coming out of Tahm nom, if it's not on CD already... which it probably is, if they're in trouble... and wait, you don't build tier 2 boots on Tahm? Problem solved.
I don't think it's gutting but basically this, I question why those 2 are left alone.

I don't have much influence over Tahm's direction personally, but if someone on the balance team told me Ryze needed to be nerfed for one reason or another, I could be on board with it. He's pretty difficult for most players (despite having a reputation for braindead keyboard spam), but he can do really powerful things in the hands of an experience player. If we thought it was too much, then we should nerf him.

I don't mind some mechanical complexity on a champ but playing Ryze feels like I'm playing stepmania, and I suck at stepmania. My fingers simply aren't fast enough to keep up with his combos which is disappointing since I really like Ryze's theme. Do you think you guys will rework him again to be less APM-dependent? And if so would it fall under the umbrella of the potential "immobile mage" reworks you guys hinted at recently?
Rework is unlikely if that were to mean anything more than some tweaks to his passive, which I'd say is possible.

Difference being, Tahm can make the #LC$BIGPLAY$ and others(plural) like Quinn cannot.  You know as well as I, this game is balanced largely around making competitive games as visually entertaining to watch as possible.

Rito almost never makes changes for the sake of real balance, every single change made is based solely on their employees' own biases.  Jag himself publicly stated this fact.

dunno...i really hate tahm in competitive - everytime a team makes a good play Tahm just eats the catched out player and then wins. It really takes a lot away from the games. like an insanly buffed thresh lantern.

Yes, I must agree with that sentiment and that Tahm is undoubtedly an issue in that regard.  Having said that, I still believe Thresh is the better of the two.  Perhaps just for being more the generalist type of champion that can be picked into 99.9% of situations.

Let's also not forget Thresh's lantern has a cast range of 950 units with a pull range of up to 1500 after grabbing it.  Tahm's Devourer only has a range of 250 units.
No amount of number tweaks will stop Tahm from doing what he does.

actually, if he´d get slowed when eating a friend and they´d nerf the shield a lot would be fixed.

though i´d also favour changing the w mechanic.

honestly you have better judgement than i ever could in terms of balance,    that being said, if you have played her and you have channeled R, what do you think of the immobility it brings? and... should minions interrupt it? What do you say in removing immobility and minion interruptability and while channeling for 2 seconds quinn has -40% MS reduction?  Quinn is LITERALLY in your hands, her future is determined by YOU i hope she's in good hands i think she might be
to be fair, this preseason is really frustrating so far...in such an environment it´s more likly for such outbursts to happen.

"my champion should be allowed to have a 60% winrate"

are you

kidding

Don't you think it's a bit kneejerk? 

Especially when her win rate **will **fall as people learn play against her (see my other post about player experience gap) & Fervor of Battle (her best keystone currently for solo lane) is being nerfed which will already hit her laning.

I just don't want it to feel like pre-rework where Q's damage is bordering on pathetic, tbh.

Also have you thought about touching passive & crit interaction? As I feel like that promotes snowballing since gives her extra power spikes when she gets crit items.

This is why I'm not going crazy just yet.

> Also have you thought about touching passive & crit interaction?

Yes, but I'm not sure what the right call is on that yet.

It had been talked about else where on the boards, that her passive should just scale with levels (or ult rank or something) rather than crit.

This would make it less snowbally, since it currently it creates extra power spikes when she's ahead and can afford the crit, but it also punishes her for being behind, or being force to not pick up crit in favor of a defensive item, or such since she then has to deal with longer passive cooldowns.

Which is why I think if you're looking to reduce her need to snowball & her snowball potential, it's a good area to hit.

Basically what Girls Love said but I'd like to add that currently in solo lanes getting crit items is actually not always a good idea in many cases you need to prioritise situational items like Maw and even when you have freedom to go for damage I have found that Ghostblade offers far more power than any crit options. This is bad because it's like her passive is being held hostage unless you buy crit items, either removing it all together and saving some budget or having it scale down with levels would work much better, allows much more fluidity in builds and removes a mechanic that is both confusing in nature and incredibly unsatisfying to make use of. If removing the CD scaling all together I'd recommend a return to how the old passive functioned where the CD begins when applied not when consumed, but that's really just my personal bias, I liked that mechanic.

What do you think happened? She was pretty weak last patch, I feel like the vision blind on her Q isn't THAT powerful. At least not THAT much more powerful than the execute she had.

I was shocked when I checked champion.gg and saw her on top. WAY on top.

Q is dealing too much damage for the utility it provides, or it is providing too much utility for the damage it deals (or both).

Harrier is a bit stronger around levels 3-6 before she's backed and bought any AD (because it now has a base damage that is scaling with her level rather than being all AD dependent).

Some other stuff that may be contributing:

* She's really good against Illaoi
* Not having the option to rush Homeguards (which was fun, and many people were doing) may actually have been a buff because players are buying more combat-effectiveness in their early items.

Just curious, would you happen to know of illaoi's current 42% winrate is particularly low because of quinn?

Obviously she's new, people are still learning her ins and outs, but I am curiius what her winrate is when quinn is taken out of the equation.

Doing some math 80 matches of 10116, even at 70+% win rate is at best pulling win rate down by .07-8% I believe.

Malphite, Shen, Tryndamere, Nasus, Fiora, & Mundo all have more impact on her win rate due to amount of matches played and their still very high win rates against her.

It's definitely the damage, quite often I don't even consider Q as a utility spell and use it purely as a nuke and it's served me well as I'm currently rocking around an 80% win rate this patch. The ability to just perma harass by hitting the wave they are farming is way too strong. I think a higher base but a lower scaling that is bonus AD instead of total would work, something around 1.0bAD. Also it costs too little, the mana reduction down to 50 was fine when it was a spammy waveclear spell but now that it has cc it should really regain it's old cost scaling.

It might be that the vision reduction is also a bit strong but honestly I don't think that's the case people just blame it when they die, it's a common thing that people do. I know I curse the very hell that spawned her every time I fall victim to an Ahri charm but that doesn't mean the ability is that unfair, the fact is Quinn's Q is very narrow and the animation is pretty long still so it's not really that hard to dodge and without it landing she's basically dead meat vs any decent ranged character.

Basically it still has the problem she had last patch where her Q scales so damn well that as soon as you get any lead you am become death: destroyer of games and proceed to ram your pet bird down everyone's throat until all lanes are at your mercy, the difference is now she has more harrier damage, her Q is better for harass and she has utility. To beat the dead horse I still think the ultimate's current state is to blame for a lot of the problems, it's hard to balance a champion that is inherently snowbally(any ranged carry ever) when they can be anywhere at any time.

Something to bear in mind is that Quinn has always always been strong early and that now games are shorter she isn't subjected to the part of the game she is most terrible at which can account for a chunk of her win rate, she still has a negative one in 40min games if I'm remembering right it's just that games don't tend to last until that stage lately, I actually had a 14min game today.

"utility" that can only be applied if the enemy sits out in the open, and doesnt move slightly to the left.  so far the best use of her Q ive had is screwwing lee out of a ward jump when he tried to escape... cant jump to what you cant see.

Yeah the blind is toxic. I thought she fine without it but muh god.

Thing is though, she doesn't have any sort of hard cc, just pure damage....
Not defending her, but masteries seem to be breeding all the evils of the pre-season.
I feel she will be another {{champion:113}}, has oppressive win rates, so riot nerfs both her core build ie {{item:1401}} and her damage in all. And now she is sub par like she was before :/
{{champion:133}} never allowed to be good...
She DOES have hard CC. Her E can delete a fiddlestick's ult.
displacement isn't a strong reliable cc... {{champion:38}} q still cancels channels... is that hard cc too?

Can I ask about the nerf behind Swain? 

I know it's from the keystone buff, but why is his W touched and not his E?
I'm not 100% certain, but I'd guess it's because the team thinks W is giving too much value as a 1-pt wonder.

the thing is...it´s also his only real waveclear tool. So right now he has the choice for more singl-target dmg/cc by maxing q 2nd and more waveclear with maxing w 2nd. After this changes he will have to max w 2nd in all situations and still lose most of his lane-pressence early on, basically making him a no-go champ in higher elos unless in very specific matchups.

I mean, yeah that makes sense.

Carry on sir!

Please wait.

This is the first time Quinn has **EVER** been good. The first time in THREE YEARS she hasn't been a joke-tier trash champ. And her opponents aren't used to that.

People aren't used to fighting her yet. Give her a bit more time, please. Nobody knows her counterplay.

I accept that nerfs are in order, but give it some time first. Give us at LEAST 5.24 to be OP, and see if the playerbase can't learn how to deal.
the damage is fine. the long range zero counter-play super-blind is not.
The counterplay is supposed to be dodging it. It's not a particularly fast or wide missile.

> [{quoted}](name=RiotRepertoir,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=XO82jltL,comment-id=000600080000,timestamp=2015-11-28T17:29:13.464+0000)
>
> The counterplay is supposed to be dodging it. It's not a particularly fast or wide missile.

It's impossible to dodge point blank, and it makes casting spells impossible.  It's really strong.  She just feels like you are fighting a lot of invisible undodgeable power, because everything is invisible when you are blind.  She is the fastest champion in the game and she has a lot of ability to deny escape with vault, so once she gets ahead she is suffocating.

"Invisible power" refers to things that you won't even realize are part of a champion's kit unless you explicitly look for it.

For example, most players probably don't know that Cassiopeia gets a free Deathcap passive and 25% CDR before 30 minutes. That's invisible power—something you have to look for with the express intent of learning about it. In Cass' case, you have to select her and hover over her passive's buff icon. They might not know her Q gives her movement speed for hitting champions, and her E heals her, too. Cassiopeia's kit is full of invisible power, and almost all of it is stacked up on her passive.

Tahm Kench gets health-scaling bonus damage when he gets his ultimate. A lot of people don't know about that, and unlike Rek'Sai or even Cassiopeia's passive animation there's no indicator whatsoever. This is invisible power.

Quinn's Harrier is 100% clear, and it can affect minions, so you know how it's procced. You can tell exactly what the effects of her blind are once you're hit by it, and which ability causes it. This is power that's on display for everyone to see. Unlike Ekko and the execution passive on his W (which you'd only ever learn of if you research), it also doesn't take long to figure out that Quinn gets movement and attack speed when she procs her passive (even if it's only directly tied to ranking her W, but that part isn't necessary knowledge as long as it's easy to realize it exists).

Quinn's power is not "invisible" in the least.

im not sure how im supposed to dodge something when i am knocked up? 

mid-late game if you see valor running at you and you dont have a targeted CC, you are fucked...  dodges any skill shots on the way in... soon as she is in range you are knocked up... then you cant see anything past your feet. where is the part where you get to dodge her q?

The knockup is like a quarter-second. It probably takes her longer to LAND then it does for that thing to end. As long as you have ANY mobillity maneuver whatsoever, Q should be dodgable. It's likely the E's subsequent SLOW that screws most players without some kind of dash. The slow prevents any simple sidestep dodging.
